pageContext.claim: “In Pennsylvania the Secretary of State and the state Supreme Court in essence abolished signature verification requirements just weeks prior to the election, in violation of state law. You're not allowed to do that. It has to be approved by the legislature. A judge can't do it, a state can't do it, an official can't do it. The only one that can do it is the legislature.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump's claims that the ruling "in essence" abolished signature verification. But the court concluded that there was no clause in the state’s election code that allowed ballots to be rejected based on signature comparisons, and if the state’s lawmakers wanted one, they would have included it
